DirectoryFsWatcher.name: DirectoryFsWatcher
DirectoryFsWatcher.description:
Defines a directory watcher which is a wrapper around Node.js fs.watch.

fs.watch only emit "change" and "rename" events, nothing more.
This class intends to make it more user friendly by emitting more understandable events like "create" or "delete".

It analyzes only "rename" events, "change" events are not constant between Linux and Windows systems.
On both Linux and Windows systems :
When a file is added a "rename" event is emitted followed by a "change" event
When a file is renamed a "rename" event is emitted twice (one for the removal and one for the addition)
When a file is removed a "rename" event is emitted

To work through this behaviour, a snapshot of the directory is made each time a "rename" event is fired.
Then new resources inside the directory are compared to the snapshot to find out which resource has been
added or removed.

If a "rename" event is emitted while the directory is being analyzed, directory will be analyzed again making every
"rename" event count.

params.name: directoryPath
params.description: The absolute path of the directory to watch

params.name: options
params.description: Watcher options

props.name: stabilityThreshold
props.description:
Number of milliseconds to wait before considering a file
as stable

DirectoryWatcher.description: Defines a directory watcher to watch for changes inside a directory and its sub directories.

classitems.description:
Executes an update operation on the given media.

Only one update operation can be performed at a time. Pending operations
are added to the queue and executed sequentially.

classitems.description: Executes oldest update in the queue.

Resolves videos resources urls using CDN url.

Videos may have attached resources like files associated to tags, timecodes images, thumbnail image and
so on. These resources must be accessible through an url. As all resources must, in the future, reside in
a CDN, resolveResourcesUrls transforms all resources URIs to URLs based on CDN.

params.description: The list of videos

classitems.description:
Uploads to youtube in a fail safe way, using resumable uploads.

The upload can fail 3 times before failing globally, each times it fails it perform an upload again
starting where it previously failed (ie: not re-upoloading all the video)

 - **String** The uploaded media id

classitems.description: The Node.js directory watcher.
classitems.name: fsWatcher

classitems.description: Waits for the resource to be fully written.

params.description: Last information about the resource

classitems.description:
Interprets a "rename" event.

If "rename" event corresponds to an addition, a "create" event will be fired.
If "rename" event corresponds to a removal, a "delete" event will be fired.
classitems.name: interpretRename

Media package must be of one of the supported type.

classitems.description:
Retries publishing all packages in a non stable state.

Stable states are :
- STATES.ERROR
- STATES.WAITING_FOR_UPLOAD
- STATES.READY
- STATES.PUBLISHED

classitems.description:
Prepares plugin by creating required database indexes.

This is automatically called by core application after plugin is loaded.

params.description:
Function to call when it's done with :
 - **Error** An error if something went wrong, null otherwise

classitems.description:
Starts the watcher when plugin is ready.

This is automatically called by core application after plugin is initialized.
classitems.name: start

params.name: callback
params.description:
Function to call when it's done with :
 - **Error** An error if something went wrong, null otherwise

warnings.message:
Missing item type
Gets the closure to remove the given directory.

Missing item type
Executes oldest update in the queue.

Missing item type
Resolves videos resources urls using CDN url.

Videos may have attached resources like files associated to tags, timecodes images, thumbnail image and
so on. These resources must be accessible through an url. As all resources must, in the future, reside in
a CDN, resolveResourcesUrls transforms all resources URIs to URLs based on CDN.
